metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43634 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the dsi_writeinit function. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-17646.

criterions.comment: netatalk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
